TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ContentControl

Docs.summary: An individual content control. Content controls are bounded and potentially labeled regions in a document that serve as containers for specific types of content. Individual content controls may contain contents such as dates, lists, or paragraphs of formatted text. The ContentControl object is a member of the collection.

remarks.para: Use the method of the collection to create a content control. Use the parameter of the Add method to specify the type of content control to create.

Use the property to change the content control to a different type of content control. For example, perhaps you want to change from a date control to a text control. However, you may not be able to change all content controls to another type; some may not allow changing their type. In addition, depending on the contents of a content control, you may not be able to change the type. For example, if the content control that you want to change to does not allow the type of content that is in the existing content control, attempting to change the type is not allowed and generates a run-time error.

Use the method to change the placeholder text from the default string to something more appropriate for the control. Use the property to specify the title text for the control. This displays above the control when the cursor is positioned inside the control or the mouse pointer is positioned over the control.
Depending on the type of content control that you have, you may not be able to use all the properties and methods of the ContentControl object.
Not all content control properties apply to all the different types of content controls. The following table lists which properties apply to which types of content controls.

item.description: Combo box and drop-down list content controls ( and )

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool AllowInsertDeleteSection { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether users can add or remove sections from the specified repeating section content control by using the user interface.

remarks.para: You can use this property only with repeating section content controls. Using it with other content controls will result in an error message effect.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdContentControlAppearance Appearance { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdContentControlAppearance get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdContentControlAppearance value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the appearance of the content control. Read/write

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Application As Application

Docs.summary: Returns an object that represents the Microsoft Word application.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ BuildingBlockCategory { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the category for a building block content control. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property applies only to building block content controls and corresponds with the Category option in the Content Control Properties dialog box. You can set this property to any string; however, if you set it to a string for which there is no corresponding category, the value of the Category option is set to "(All Categories)".

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdBuildingBlockTypes BuildingBlockType { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdBuildingBlockTypes get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdBuildingBlockTypes value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the type of building block for a building block content control. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property applies only to building block content controls and corresponds with the Gallery option in the Content Control Properties dialog box. You can set this property only for the following building block types:

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Checked { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the current state (checked/unchecked) for a check box.
Docs.value: true if the check box is checked; otherwise; false.

remarks.para: Read/write. Use this property to get or set the current state for a check box content control. If the control is not a check box, attempts to access the property fail with the run-time error “This property is only available for check box content controls."

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdColor Color { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdColor get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdColor value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the color of the content control. Read/write .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Copy() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Copies the content control from the active document to the Clipboard.

remarks.para: When you use the Copy method, the original content control remains in the active document, but a copy of the control, including all text and property settings, is moved to the Clipboard. You can then paste the content control into other sections of the active document. Use the method of the object or the method of the object to insert the copied content control, or use the Paste function from within Microsoft Office Word.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Creator As Integer
public: property int Creator { int get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a 32-bit integer that indicates the application in which the add-in was created. Read-only.

remarks.para: If the object was created in Microsoft Word, the Creator property returns the hexadecimal number 4D535744, which represents the string "MSWD." This property was primarily designed to be used on the Macintosh, where each application has a four-character creator code. For example, Microsoft Word has the creator code MSWD. For additional information about this property, consult the language reference Help included with Microsoft Office Macintosh Edition.
Note: This value can also be represented by the constant .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Cut() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Removes the content control from the active document and moves the content control to the Clipboard.

remarks.para: When you use the Copy method, the original content control remains in the active document, but a copy of the control, including all text and property settings, is moved to the Clipboard. You can then paste the content control into other sections of the active document. Use the method of the object or the method of the object to insert the copied content control, or use the Paste function from within Microsoft Office Word.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdCalendarType DateCalendarType { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdCalendarType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdCalendarType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the calendar type for a calendar content control. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ DateDisplayFormat { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the format in which dates are displayed. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default format is the format setting specified in Microsoft Office Word on the users' system, which usually depends on the location setting in Microsoft Windows. For example, the default format of dates for English (U.S.) is "mm/dd/yyyy". Use the property to specify a different date format.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID DateDisplayLocale { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdLanguageID value); };

Docs.summary: Returns a the language format for the date displayed in a date content control. Read/write.

remarks.para: By default, the property is initially set to the editing language specified in Microsoft Office Word, if this is different from the location specified in Microsoft Windows.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdContentControlDateStorageFormat DateStorageFormat { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdContentControlDateStorageFormat get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdContentControlDateStorageFormat value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the format for storage and retrieval of dates when a date content control is bound to the XML data store of the active document. Read/write.

remarks.para: The property allows you to store dates in date format, date/time format, or text format.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Object ^ DefaultTextStyle { System::Object ^ get(); void set(System::Object ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the name of the character style to use to format text in a text content control. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Delete([in]bool DeleteContents) runtime managed
Public Sub Delete (Optional DeleteContents As Boolean = false)

Docs.param: Specifies whether to delete the contents of the content control. True removes both the content control and its contents. False removes the control but leaves the contents of the content control in the active document. The default value is False.
Docs.summary: Deletes the specified content control and the contents of the content control.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property DropdownListEntries As ContentControlListEntries

Docs.summary: Returns the items in a drop-down list content control or in a combo box content control. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ID As String
public: property System::String ^ ID { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns the identification for a content control. Read-only.

remarks.para: The ID property is an internal number that you cannot change but that you can use to identify a content control in code. This number is unique for each content control and does not change.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Level As WdContentControlLevel

Docs.summary: Returns the level of the content control—whether the content control surrounds text, paragraphs, table cells, or table rows; or if it is inline. Read-only .

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool LockContentControl { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean that represents whether the user can delete a content control from the active document. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value of this property is False. This property corresponds to the Content control cannot be deleted check box in the Content Control Properties dialog box.
Note: You cannot set this property if the property is set to True.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool LockContents { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean that represents whether the user can edit the contents of a content control. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value of this property is False. This property corresponds to the Contents cannot be edited check box in the Content Control Properties dialog box.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool MultiLine { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean that represents whether a text content control allows multiple lines of text. Read/write.

remarks.para: This property applies only to text content controls and rich text content controls.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Parent As Object
public: property System::Object ^ Parent { System::Object ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns an that represents the parent object of the specified object.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ParentContentControl As ContentControl

Docs.summary: Returns the parent content control for a content control that is nested inside a rich-text control or group control. Read-only.

remarks.para: If a content control is not nested, this proprerty returns an error.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property PlaceholderText As BuildingBlock

Docs.summary: Returns a object that represents the placeholder text for a content control. Read-only.

remarks.para: Use the method to set the placeholder text for a content control.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Range As Range
public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Range ^ Range { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::Range ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a that represents the contents of the content control in the active document. Read-only.

remarks.para: Use the property to access the text, the formatting for the text, and other text properties. For more information, see Working with Range Objects

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RepeatingSectionItems As RepeatingSectionItemColl

Docs.summary: Returns the collection of repeating section items in the specified repeating section content control. Read-only.

remarks.para: You can use this property with repeating section content controls only. Using it with other content controls will result in an error.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ RepeatingSectionItemTitle { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the name of the repeating section items used in the context menu associated with the specified repeating section content control. Read/write.

remarks.para: You can use this property with repeating section content controls only. Using it with other content controls will result in an error.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetCheckedSymbol (int CharacterNumber, string Font = "");
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetCheckedSymbol([in]int32 CharacterNumber, [in]string Font) runtime managed
Public Sub SetCheckedSymbol (CharacterNumber As Integer, Optional Font As String = "")

Docs.param: The Unicode character number for the specified symbol. This value will always be the sum of 31 (the number of control symbols at the beginning of the font) and the number that corresponds to the position of the symbol in the table of symbols (counting from left to right). For example, to specify a delta character at position 37 in the table of symbols in the Symbol font, set to 68.
The name of the font that contains the symbol.
Docs.summary: Sets the symbol used to represent the checked state of a check box content control.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetPlaceholderText (Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.BuildingBlock BuildingBlock = null, Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range = null, string Text = "");

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetPlaceholderText([in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.BuildingBlock BuildingBlock, [in]class Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.Range Range, [in]string Text) runtime managed

Docs.param: Specifies a object that contains the contents of the placeholder text.
Specifies a object that contains the contents of the placeholder text.
Specifies the contents of the placeholder text.
Docs.summary: Sets the placeholder text that displays in the content control until a user enters their own text.

remarks.para: Only one of the parameters is used when specifying placeholder text. If more than one parameter is used, Microsoft Office Word uses the text specified in the first parameter. If all parameters are omitted, the placeholder text is blank.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetUncheckedSymbol (int CharacterNumber, string Font = "");
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetUncheckedSymbol([in]int32 CharacterNumber, [in]string Font) runtime managed
Public Sub SetUncheckedSymbol (CharacterNumber As Integer, Optional Font As String = "")

Docs.param: The Unicode character number for the specified symbol. This value will always be the sum of 31 (the number of control symbols at the beginning of the font) and the number that corresponds to the position of the symbol in the table of symbols (counting from left to right). For example, to specify a delta character at position 37 in the table of symbols in the Symbol font, set to 68.
The name of the font that contains the symbol.
Docs.summary: Sets the symbol used to represent the unchecked state of a check box content control.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property ShowingPlaceholderText As Boolean
public: property bool ShowingPlaceholderText { bool get(); };

Docs.summary: Returns a Boolean that indicates whether the placeholder text for the content control is displayed. Read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Tag { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a value to identify a content control. Read/write.

remarks.para: The property is different from the property in that a tag is never displayed while a user edits a document. Instead, developers can use it to store a value for programmatic manipulation while the document is opened.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool Temporary { bool get(); void set(bool value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean that represents whether to remove a content control from the active document when the user edits the contents of the control. Read/write.

remarks.para: The default value is False. This property corresponds to the Remove content control when contents are edited check box in the Content Control Properties dialog box.
Note: You cannot set this property if the property is set to True.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Title { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the title for a content control. Read/write.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdContentControlType Type { Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdContentControlType get(); void set(Microsoft::Office::Interop::Word::WdContentControlType value); };

Docs.summary: Returns or sets the type for a content control. Read/write.

remarks.para: You can use the property to change the type of a content control from one type to another. However, the ability to change the type of control depends on the original type and on the content inside the content control at the time of the change. All content controls can be changed to rich text or building block gallery type content controls because these types allow arbitrary content. For other types, if the content is valid for the type that you want to change to, then changing the type is allowed. Otherwise, the change is rejected, resulting in a run-time error.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Ungroup() runtime managed

Docs.summary: Removes a group content control from a document so that its child content controls are no longer nested and can be freely edited.

remarks.para: This method fails if you run it on a control that is not of type .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property XMLMapping As XMLMapping

Docs.summary: Returns the mapping of a content control to XML data in the data store of a document. Read-only.
